channel.title: How to put server on vps?
channel.description: Like I know you have to put the source in the vps. But do you also have to put the client inside? And how will the client find the source if your running client on a different computer and source on a different computer. And do I have to give the whole client folder to people? The client folder contains all the files like client.java, do I have to give them those as well? Cuz if I do they can easily just edit it ...

item.title: How to put server on vps?
item.dc:creator: @Fierystr Fierystr
item.description:
@Fierystr wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:7, topic:393997”][quote author=Fierystr link=topic=491182.msg3591931#msg3591931 date=1304715307]

[quote author=XxJtxX link=topic=491182.msg3591929#msg3591929 date=1304715243]

Like I know you have to put the source in the vps. But do you also have to put the client inside? And how will the client find the source if your running client on a different computer and source on a different computer. And do I have to give the whole client folder to people? The client folder contains all the files like client.java, do I have to give them those as well? Cuz if I do they can easily just edit it …
[/quote]You are right, a person canedit the client if you do not take precautions. what I would suggest doing is making a .jar and releasing that if not a webclient.

Use my jarring tutorial which can be found here.

http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,490803.0.html
[/quote]Why would he need to put a client on a VPS in the first place?

That has nothign to do with it. I said when I give the client to other people… and I have another question. the client folder is 70 mb… anyway I can shorten it?

take your cache out of the client lol

the cache will download to the other persons local disk c as long as you follow my guide. :)[/quote]

oh thanks!

Read full topic
item.source: How to put server on vps?

Like I know you have to put the source in the vps. But do you also have to put the client inside? And how will the client find the source if your running client on a different computer and source on a different computer. And do I have to give the whole client folder to people? The client folder contains all the files like client.java, do I have to give them those as well? Cuz if I do they can easily just edit it …
[/quote]You are right, a person canedit the client if you do not take precautions. what I would suggest doing is making a .jar and releasing that if not a webclient.

Use my jarring tutorial which can be found here.

http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,490803.0.html
[/quote]Why would he need to put a client on a VPS in the first place?

That has nothign to do with it. I said when I give the client to other people… and I have another question. the client folder is 70 mb… anyway I can shorten it?[/quote]

take your cache out of the client lol

the cache will download to the other persons local disk c as long as you follow my guide.

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=491182.msg3591919#msg3591919 date=1304714992]

Like I know you have to put the source in the vps. But do you also have to put the client inside? And how will the client find the source if your running client on a different computer and source on a different computer. And do I have to give the whole client folder to people? The client folder contains all the files like client.java, do I have to give them those as well? Cuz if I do they can easily just edit it …
[/quote]You are right, a person canedit the client if you do not take precautions. what I would suggest doing is making a .jar and releasing that if not a webclient.

Use my jarring tutorial which can be found here.

That has nothign to do with it. I said when I give the client to other people… and I have another question. the client folder is 70 mb… anyway I can shorten it?[/quote]Sorry, couldn’t really understand your post. And by the way, it’s your cache that is probably around 67 mb.

And how will the client find the source if your running client on a different computer and source on a different computer. And do I have to give the whole client folder to people? The client folder contains all the files like client.java, do I have to give them those as well? Cuz if I do they can easily just edit it …
[/quote]You are right, a person canedit the client if you do not take precautions. what I would suggest doing is making a .jar and releasing that if not a webclient.

Use my jarring tutorial which can be found here.

[/quote]Why would he need to put a client on a VPS in the first place?[/quote]

That has nothign to do with it. I said when I give the client to other people… and I have another question. the client folder is 70 mb… anyway I can shorten it?
